body_html:
So yes it worked. Thanks!
it is way faster, but still slightly slower than when I run it in 0.3.
btw, I have the same function written in c++ (extension) and python, it looks like the issue of indexing is not that apparent in the c++ version as in the python version, but the code sped up when I indexed the tensor internal data .data_ptr() rather than the tensor itself.
body_text:
So yes it worked. Thanks!
it is way faster, but still slightly slower than when I run it in 0.3.
btw, I have the same function written in c++ (extension) and python, it looks like the issue of indexing is not that apparent in the c++ version as in the python version, but the code sped up when I indexed the tensor internal data .data_ptr() rather than the tensor itself.
body:
So yes it worked. Thanks! 
it is way faster, but still slightly slower than when I run it in 0.3.
btw, I have the same function written in c++ (extension) and python, it looks like the issue of indexing is not that apparent in the c++ version as in the python version, but the code sped up when I indexed the tensor internal data `.data_ptr()` rather than the tensor itself.
